attributes.additional_details:
Vaccines not only protect the individual vaccinated, but the surrounding people too. For example if someone was allergic to the vaccine and could not be immunised they would be at risk from the disease. So people who are vaccinated cannot pass it on to them keeping them safe.

Furthermore many people say that vaccines cause autism, that is false information, based on outdated, biased, research by a scientist who used this for personal gain and profit.

And, vaccines are not toxic.
attributes.background: For several years now, many misinformed people have decided not to vaccinate their children. This has to stop. Each year many children and unvaccinated people, are endangered by the threat of disease, which can be prevented. Vaccinations have: after investigation, been proven safe and reliable
